rti_python.Ensemble package¶

Submodules¶

rti_python.Ensemble.Amplitude module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.Amplitude.Amplitude(num_elements, element_multiplier)¶

Bases: object

Amplitude DataSet. [Bin x Beam] data.

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the velocities. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size)¶

Encode the Amplitude into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Size of the bin in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

is_good_bin(bin_num: int, min_amp: float) → bool¶

Verify if the given bin has good data based on the minimum amplitude value given. :param bin_num: Bin Number :param min_amp: Minimum amplitude value. :return: TRUE = All beams have amplitude values greater than min value given.

pd0_counts(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Amplitude to Counts. 0.5dB per count.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

A list of all the Amplitude for the given PD0 beam, converted to counts for the beam. The beam will be based on reordering for PD0

Return type

List or None if beam number is not correct.

rti_python.Ensemble.AncillaryData module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.AncillaryData.AncillaryData(num_elements=19, element_multiplier=1)¶

Bases: object

Ancillary Data DataSet. Float values that give details about the ensemble.

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the values. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank=0, bin_size=0)¶

Encode into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

encode_df(dt, ss_code, ss_config)¶

Encode into Dataframe format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :return: Dataframe of the data.

is_upward_facing(min_roll: float = 0.0, max_roll: float = 20.0)¶

Check the roll value if it is near 0 degrees. A value near zero means the ADCP is upward facing. Upward looking is around 0 degrees for roll. Downward looking is around 180 degrees for roll.

Parameters

  • min_roll – Minimum roll for upward looking taking absolute value.

  • max_roll – Maximum roll for the upward looking taking absolute value.

Returns

TRUE if Upward facing.

rti_python.Ensemble.BeamVelocity module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.BeamVelocity.BeamVelocity(num_elements, element_multiplier)¶

Bases: object

Beam Velocity DataSet. [Bin x Beam] data.

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the velocities. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size)¶

Encode into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

pd0_mm_per_sec(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Beam Velocity from m/s to mm/s and as an integer.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

A list of all the velocities for the given PD0 beam, converted to mm/s for the beam. The beam will be based on reordering for PD0

Return type

List or None if beam number is not correct.

rti_python.Ensemble.BottomTrack module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.BottomTrack.BottomTrack(num_elements=74, element_multiplier=1)¶

Bases: object

Ensemble Data DataSet. Integer values that give details about the ensemble.

Corr_PulseCoherent¶

for beams in range(element_multiplier): self.Range.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.SNR.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.Amplitude.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.Correlation.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.BeamVelocity.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.BeamGood.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.InstrumentVelocity.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.InstrumentGood.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.EarthVelocity.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity) self.EarthGood.append(Ensemble().BadVelocity)

avg_range()¶

Return the average range (depth to the bottom). This will determine the good values for the range and average them together.

Returns

Average range.

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the velocities. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank=0, bin_size=0)¶

Encode into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

encode_df(dt, ss_code, ss_config)¶

Encode into Dataframe array format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param vel_bad_val: Change bad velocity value for Earth Velocity :param mag_bad_val: Change bad velocity value for Magnitude value :param include_bad_vel: Include the velocity if it is bad, or remove it :param include_bad_mag: Include the magnitude if it is bad, or remove it :return: List of CSV lines.

get_vessel_direction()¶

This will calculate the vessel direction. You will need 2 beams of good data to calculate the vessel speed.

If you do not have 2 beams or any of the velocities for a beam are bad, this will return BAD_VELOCITY.

Returns

Vessel speed or BAD_VELOCITY.

get_vessel_speed()¶

This will calculate the vessel speed (magnitude). You will need 3 beams of good data to calculate the vessel speed.

If you do not have 3 beams or any of the velocities for a beam are bad, this will return BAD_VELOCITY.

Returns

Vessel speed or BAD_VELOCITY.

pd0_amp_counts(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Amplitude/Echo Intensity to Counts. 0.5dB per count.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Amplitude data as PD0 counts format. Beams are reordered

Return type

Float - Amplitude value.

pd0_beam_vel_mm_per_sec(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Beam Velocity from m/s to mm/s.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Velocity for the given PD0 beam, converted to mm/s for the beam. The beam will be based on reordering for PD0

Return type

Velocity data for given beam.

pd0_corr_counts(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

The value has to be converted from percentage to 0 - 255 Scale 0 % - 100 % to 0 - 255 255 = 100 % 0 = 0 % 50 % = 0.50 * 255 = 127.5 = 255 / 2

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Correlation data as PD0 counts format. Beams are reordered

Return type

Float - Correlation value.

pd0_good_beam_percent(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Good Beams to percentage.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Good Beams data as PD0 as a percentage. Beams are reordered

Return type

Float - Good Beams value.

pd0_range_cm(pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the range from meters to centimeters.

Remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Ranges for the given PD0 beam, converted to centimeters for the beam. The beam will be based on reordering for PD0

Return type

Float - Range value.

status_str()¶

Convert the status value to a string. :return: Status value as a string.

rti_python.Ensemble.Correlation module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.Correlation.Correlation(num_elements, element_multiplier)¶

Bases: object

Correlation DataSet. [Bin x Beam] data.

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the velocities. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size)¶

Encode the Correlation into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin Size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

is_good_bin(bin_num: int, min_corr: float) → bool¶

Verify if the given bin has good data based on the minimum correlation value given. :param bin_num: Bin Number :param min_corr: Minimum Correlation value. :return: TRUE = All beams have amplitude values greater than min value given.

pd0_counts(num_repeat: int, pd0_beam_num: int)¶

The value has to be converted from percentage to 0 - 255 Scale 0 % - 100 % to 0 - 255 255 = 100 % 0 = 0 % 50 % = 0.50 * 255 = 127.5 = 255 / 2

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

  • num_repeat (Integer) – Number of code repeats.

  • pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

Returns

Correlation data as PD0 counts format. Beams are reordered

Return type

List of Correlation values.

rti_python.Ensemble.EarthVelocity module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.EarthVelocity.EarthVelocity(num_elements, element_multiplier)¶

Bases: object

Earth Velocity DataSet. [Bin x Beam] data.

average_mag_dir()¶

Generate the average Magnitude and direction for the entire ensemble. Assume the ship speed has already been removed. This will also filter for all bad velocities when taking the average. :return: [Avg_MAG, Avg_DIR] Average Magnitude and Direction. None if no value can be calculated

decode(data)¶

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the velocities. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size)¶

Encode into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

encode_df(dt, ss_code, ss_config, vel_bad_val=88.888, mag_bad_val=88.888, include_bad_vel=True, include_bad_mag=True)¶

Encode into Dataframe array format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param vel_bad_val: Change bad velocity value for Earth Velocity :param mag_bad_val: Change bad velocity value for Magnitude value :param include_bad_vel: Include the velocity if it is bad, or remove it :param include_bad_mag: Include the magnitude if it is bad, or remove it :return: List of CSV lines.

static generate_vectors(earth_vel)¶

Generate the velocity vectors. This will calculate the magnitude and direction of the water. If any of the data is marked bad in a bin, then the magnitude and direction will also be marked bad.

Call this again and set the self.Magnitude and self.Direction when Bottom Track Velocity is available.

Parameters

earth_vel – Earth Velocities[bin][beam]

Returns

[magnitude], [direction] List with a value for each bin

generate_velocity_vectors()¶

Generate the velocity vectors for this object. This will set both Magnitude and direction. :return:

is_good_bin(bin_num: int) → bool¶

Verify if the given bin has good data based on BAD_VELOCITY. :param bin_num: Bin Number :return: TRUE = All beams do not have BAD_VELOCITY.

remove_vessel_speed(bt_east=0.0, bt_north=0.0, bt_vert=0.0)¶

Remove the vessel speed. If the bottom track data is good and the velocity is good, then remove the vessel speed from the earth speed.

The bottom track velocity is the vessel velocity. You can also use GPS data as a backup.

Calculate the East and North component from the GPS speed bt_east = Convert.ToSingle(speed * Math.Sin(MathHelper.DegreeToRadian(heading))); bt_north = Convert.ToSingle(speed * Math.Cos(MathHelper.DegreeToRadian(heading)));

Parameters

  • bt_east – Bottom Track East velocity

  • bt_north – Bottom Track North velocity

  • bt_vert – Bottom Track Vertical velocity

Returns

class rti_python.Ensemble.Ensemble.Ensemble¶

Bases: object

RoweTech Binary Ensemble. RTB format.

AddAmplitude(ds)¶

Add a Amplitude object to the ensemble. Set the flag that the dataset is added. :param ds: Amplitude object.

static GetFloat(start, numBytes, ens)¶

Convert the bytes given into an int32. This will look in the ens given. :param start: Start location. :param numBytes: Number of bytes in the int32. :param ens: Buffer containing the bytearray data. :return: Int32 of the data in the buffer.

static array_1d_to_df(vel_array, dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size, first_ens_num, last_ens_num)¶

Convert the given 1D array to a dataframe. Columns: Index, TimeStamp, Bin, Beam, SS_Code, SS_Config, BinSize, Blank, BinDepth, Value Columns: Index, time_stamp, ss_code, ss_config, bin_num, beam_num, bin_depth, first_ens_num, last_ens_num, value

dictionary to dataframe to speed up performance https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27929472/improve-row-append-performance-on-pandas-dataframes

Parameters

  • vel_array – 2D array containing the data

  • dt – DateTime

  • ss_code – SS Code as a string

  • ss_config – SS Configuration as int

  • blank – Blanking distance.

  • bin_size – Bin Size

  • first_ens_num – First Ensemble Number.

  • last_ens_num – Last Ensemble Number.

Returns

Dataframe of all the data from the array given.

static array_2d_to_df(vel_array, dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size, first_ens_num, last_ens_num)¶

Convert the given 2D array to a dataframe. Columns: Index, TimeStamp, Bin, Beam, SS_Code, SS_Config, BinSize, Blank, BinDepth, Value Columns: Index, time_stamp, ss_code, ss_config, bin_num, beam_num, bin_depth, first_ens_num, last_ens_num, value

dictionary to dataframe to speed up performance https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27929472/improve-row-append-performance-on-pandas-dataframes

Parameters

  • vel_array – 2D array containing the data

  • dt – DateTime

  • ss_code – SS Code as a string

  • ss_config – SS Configuration as int

  • blank – Blanking distance.

  • bin_size – Bin Size

  • first_ens_num – First Ensemble Number.

  • last_ens_num – Last Ensemble Number.

Returns

Dataframe of all the data from the array given.

static array_beam_1d_to_df(range_array, dt, ss_code, ss_config, first_ens_num, last_ens_num)¶

Convert the given 1D array to a dataframe. This 1D array should have 4 or less values representing a value for each beam. Columns: Index, TimeStamp, Bin, Beam, SS_Code, SS_Config, BinSize, Blank, BinDepth, Value Columns: Index, time_stamp, ss_code, ss_config, bin_num, beam_num, bin_depth, first_ens_num, last_ens_num, value

dictionary to dataframe to speed up performance https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27929472/improve-row-append-performance-on-pandas-dataframes

Parameters

  • range_array – 1D Beam array containing the data

  • dt – DateTime

  • ss_code – SS Code as a string

  • ss_config – SS Configuration as int

  • first_ens_num – First Ensemble Number.

  • last_ens_num – Last Ensemble Number.

Returns

Dataframe of all the data from the array given.

static calculate_direction(east, north)¶

Calculate the direction of the water current. This will return a value between 0 and 360. :param east: Earth East Velocity :param north: Earth North Velocity :return: Direction of the water

static calculate_magnitude(east, north, vertical)¶

Calculate the magnitude of the water current. :param east: Earth East Velocity :param north: Earth North Velocity :param vertical: Earth Vertical Velocity :return: Magnitude value

static float_to_bytes(value)¶

Convert the given float value to 4 bytes. :param value: Value to convert. :return: 4 Bytes representing the value.

static gen_csv_line(dt, data_type, ss_code, ss_config, bin_num, beam_num, blank, bin_size, value)¶

Create a csv line. Use this so all the lines have the same format.

Ex: 2019/03/07 00:51:35:478159, Amp, 1, 3, A, 1, 7.4, 23.03 :param dt: :param data_type: Data type. Names given above starting CSV_ :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem configuration number. :param bin_num: Bin Number :param beam_num: Beam Number. :param blank: Blank or first bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :param value: Value for this line. :return: CSV line with all the data.

static generate_ens_header(ens_num, payload_size)¶

Generate the header for an ensemble. This will include 16 0x80 and then the ensemble number and payload size. The inverse of the ensemble number and payload size are included. :param ens_num: Ensemble number. :param payload_size: Payload size. :return: Header for an ensemble.

static generate_header(value_type, num_elements, element_multiplier, imag, name_length, name)¶

Generate the header for an ensemble dataset.

Big Endian :param value_type: Value type (float, int, string) :param num_elements: Number of elements or number of bins. :param element_multiplier: Element multipler or number of beams. :param imag: NOT USED :param name_length: Length of the name. :param name: Name of the dataset. :return: Header for a dataset.

static get_avg_range(range_array)¶

Average the array of values. Do not include the bad values in the average. :param range_array: Array to average. :return: Average value.

static get_bin_depth(blank, bin_size, bin_num)¶

Give the depth of the given bin number. Bin number is 0 based. So the first bin is bin_num=0

The depth is the center of the bin.

Parameters

  • blank – Blanking distance of depth of the first bin in meters.

  • bin_size – Bin size in meters.

  • bin_num – Bin number. Zero starting.

Returns

The depth of the given bin in meters.

static get_bin_depth_list(blank, bin_size, num_bins)¶

Give the depth of the given bin number. Bin number is 0 based. So the first bin is bin_num=0

The depth is the center of the bin.

Parameters

  • blank – Blanking distance of depth of the first bin in meters.

  • bin_size – Bin size in meters.

  • num_bins – Number of bins.

Returns

List of depths for the each bin to use in plotting.

static int32_to_bytes(value)¶

Convert the given Int32 value to 4 bytes. :param value: Value to convert. :return: 4 Bytes representing the value.

static is_bad_velocity(vel)¶

Check if the velocity given is good or bad. :param vel: Velocity value to check. :return: True if Bad Velocity.

static is_float_close(a, b, rel_tol=1e-06, abs_tol=0.0)¶

Check if the float values are the same. :param a: First float value :param b: Second float value :param rel_tol: Value within this :param abs_tol: Absolute value within this :return:

is_good_bin(bin_num: int, min_amp: float = 0.25, min_corr: float = 0.1) → bool¶

Verify the data is good for a given bin. This will check the Amplitude, Correlation and Earth Velocity data. It will check the Amplitude bin against the minimum amplitude value. It will check the Correlation against the minimum correlation value. It will check for BAD_VELOCITY in the Earth Velocity data. :param ens: Ensemble data. :param bin_num: Bin Number. :param min_amp: Minimum Amplitude value. :param min_corr: Minimum Correlation value. :return: TRUE if all values pass.

static ones_complement(val)¶

Calclaute the 1’s compliment of a number. :param val: Values to calculate. :return: 1’s compliment of value.

static oness_complement(val)¶
static toJSON(self, pretty=False)¶

Convert to JSON. :return: JSON string with indents.

rti_python.Ensemble.EnsembleData module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.EnsembleData.EnsembleData(num_elements=23, element_multiplier=1)¶

Bases: object

Ensemble Data DataSet. Integer values that give details about the ensemble.

datetime()¶

Create a datetime object from the date and time of the ensemble. If an error occurs, use the current date and time. :return: datetime of the ensemble.

datetime_str()¶

Return the date and time as a string. :return: Date time string. 2013/07/30 21:00:00.00

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the values. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

Create a string of the firmware version and subsystem code. :return:

Determine if the current ensemble is a vertical beam ensemble or other type. :return: TRUE = Vertical Beam Ensemble :rtype: bool

Convert the status value to a string. :return: Status value as a string.

rti_python.Ensemble.EnsembleReader module¶

rti_python.Ensemble.Ensemble_Compactor module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.Ensemble_Compactor.Ensemble_Compactor¶

Bases: object

Compact an ensemble. To reduce the data passed over the network and stored in the cloud. The variable names are reduced. There are no dataset descriptions. All the datasets are merged into one object.

compact(ens)¶

Compact the ensemble to smaller object. This is used to pass a smaller amount of data over the network. This will be a complete ensemble. :param ens: Ensemble to compact. :return:

rti_python.Ensemble.GoodBeam module¶

class rti_python.Ensemble.GoodBeam.GoodBeam(num_elements, element_multiplier)¶

Bases: object

Good Beam DataSet. Indicate if the beam data is good. [Bin x Beam] data.

Take the data bytearray. Decode the data to populate the Good Beams. :param data: Bytearray for the dataset.

encode()¶

Encode the data into RTB format. :return:

encode_csv(dt, ss_code, ss_config, blank, bin_size)¶

Encode into CSV format. :param dt: Datetime object. :param ss_code: Subsystem code. :param ss_config: Subsystem Configuration :param blank: Blank or First bin position in meters. :param bin_size: Bin size in meters. :return: List of CSV lines.

pd0_percent(pings_per_ens: int, pd0_beam_num: int)¶

Convert the Good Beams to Percent.

Also remap the Beam numbers to match PD0 beams. RTB and PD0 do not share the same Beam Order RTB BEAM 0,1,2,3 = PD0 BEAM 3,2,0,1

Parameters

  • pd0_beam_num (Integer) – PD0 Beam number.

  • pings_per_ens (Integer) – Number of pings in the ensemble.

Returns

A list of all the velocities for the given PD0 beam, converted to mm/s for the beam. The beam will be based on reordering for PD0

Return type

List or None if beam number is not correct.

static get_new_lat_lon_position(latitude: float, longitude: float, distance: float, bearing: float)¶

This function is typically used to create a ship track plot with a vector to represent the water current. The distance will be the magnitude of the water currents, the bearing will be the direction of the water currents. This will allow you to plot the LatLon and also a vector off this LatLon point. :param latitude: Start latitude position :param longitude: Start longitude position :param distance: Distance (magnitude) :param bearing: Direction to travel :return The new position based on the input and current position. (lat, lon)

get_new_position(distance: float, bearing: float)¶

This function is typically used to create a ship track plot with a vector to represent the water current. The distance will be the magnitude of the water currents, the bearing will be the direction of the water currents. This will allow you to plot the LatLon and also a vector off this LatLon point. :param distance: Distance (magnitude) :param bearing: Direction to travel :return The new position based on the input and current position. (lat, lon)
